backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining participant registration with age categories, prize management with default overall and age-group prizes, and query functions for retrieving participants and prizes.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting two completed features: removing category grouping from prizes display and removing the 'more prizes to be announced' section from PrizesDisplay.tsx.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-formatted summaries of all frontend files including pages, components, hooks, and configuration for the Jhajha Marathon registration application.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes using OKLCH color space, defining colors for UI components, charts, and sidebar elements.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the Jhajha Marathon Organizer application with root div and module script reference to main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router setup defining routes for home, register, and prizes pages, all wrapped in a Layout component.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Shared layout component with sticky gradient header, responsive navigation menu, marathon branding with trophy icon, and footer containing organizer contact (7069180465) and caffeine.ai attribution.
frontend/src/components/PaymentDetails.t: Payment information component displaying â‚¹100 entry fee banner, PhonePe QR code image, UPI ID (7069180465@ybl), and payee name (Raman Kumar Asbariya) with copy functionality.
frontend/src/components/PrizesDisplay.ts: Displays prizes fetched from backend with prominent medal banner for all participants, followed by a flat grid of prize cards with placement-specific colors and icons, without category grouping or future announcement sections.
frontend/src/components/RegistrationForm: React form component for participant registration using react-hook-form and TanStack Query. Collects personal information (name, email, phone, address, age category) and submits to the backend actor, showing a success component upon completion.
frontend/src/components/RegistrationSucc: Success screen component displayed after registration, showing the participant ID, next steps, and action buttons to view prizes or return home.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that manages the backend actor instance using TanStack Query, creating authenticated or anonymous actors based on Internet Identity state and invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React context provider and hook for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and AuthClient lifecycle with configurable options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Custom hooks wrapping TanStack Query for fetching participants and prizes, and mutating participant registration data through the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for theming (light/dark modes), defining colors for primary, accent, background, and UI components using HSL color space.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers around the main App component.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Landing page component featuring a hero banner, event information cards (date, location, categories), and call-to-action buttons for registration and viewing prizes.
frontend/src/pages/PrizesPage.tsx: Page component displaying the prizes and awards section with a header and the PrizesDisplay component showing available prizes by category.
frontend/src/pages/RegisterPage.tsx: Registration page component that displays a hero banner, payment details, registration instructions, and the registration form for the Jhajha Marathon 2026.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration file defining custom color schemes using OKLCH color space, container settings, border radius variables, shadows, fonts, and animation keyframes.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file documenting completed features to remove category grouping and 'more prizes to be announced' section from the prizes display.
